group_teams.description:
Ordered map of prometheus group regexes to chronosphere team slug. This is used to
determine which team will own the collection created for each prometheus group..

notification_policy_team_slug.description: The team that will own the generated notification policy

ChronoConfigCollectionsConfig.title: Configuration for when ContainerType == COLLECTIONS or DEFAULT is collections

create_if_missing.description: If true, the Dashboard will be created if it does not already exist, identified by slug. If false, an error will be returned if the Dashboard does not already exist.
If true, the LinkTemplate will be created if it does not already exist, identified by slug. If false, an error will be returned if the LinkTemplate does not already exist.

dry_run.description: If true, the LinkTemplate will not be created nor updated, and no response LinkTemplate will be returned. The response will return an error if the given LinkTemplate is invalid.

create_if_missing.description: If true, the NoopEntity will be created if it does not already exist, identified by slug. If false, an error will be returned if the NoopEntity does not already exist.
If true, the ObjectDiscoveryRule will be created if it does not already exist, identified by slug. If false, an error will be returned if the ObjectDiscoveryRule does not already exist.
If true, the SLO will be created if it does not already exist, identified by slug. If false, an error will be returned if the SLO does not already exist.

dry_run.description: If true, the SLO will not be created nor updated, and no response SLO will be returned. The response will return an error if the given SLO is invalid.

create_if_missing.description: If true, the SavedTraceSearch will be created if it does not already exist, identified by slug. If false, an error will be returned if the SavedTraceSearch does not already exist.
If true, the Service will be created if it does not already exist, identified by slug. If false, an error will be returned if the Service does not already exist.

dry_run.description: If true, the Service will not be created nor updated, and no response Service will be returned. The response will return an error if the given Service is invalid.

create_if_missing.description: If true, the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy will be created if it does not already exist, identified by slug. If false, an error will be returned if the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy does not already exist.

dry_run.description: If true, the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy will not be created nor updated, and no response TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy will be returned. The response will return an error if the given TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy is invalid.

duration.description: duration as a string in the format "28d" or "24h", etc.

label_field.description: Label field is the label field to count.

value_field.description: Value field is used to specify what field holds the numerical value.
Value field is used to specify what field holds the numerical value.

buckets.description: Buckets specify the buckets to use for the histogram.

MonitorSignalGrouping.description: SignalGrouping defines how the set of series from the query are split into signals.

label_names.description:
Set of labels names used to split series into signals.
Each unique combination of labels will result in its own signal.
For example, if label_names is ["service", "code"] then all series including labels {service="foo",code="404"}
will be grouped together in the same signal.

Cannot be used if graphite_query is set.

signal_per_series.description:
If this is true, each series will have its own signal.
If this is true then label_names cannot be set.

operation.description: The operation to which this specific strategy should apply.

RuleDeDupe.description: DeDupe is the configuration for a dedupe filter.

RuleDeleteFields.description: DeleteFields is the configuration for a delete fields rule.

RuleDrop.title: Drop is the configuration for a drop filter

RuleEmitMetrics.description: EmitMetrics is the configuration for a rule to convert logs to metrics.

name.description: Name is the name of the metric to emit.

metric_description.description: Metric description is the description of the metric.

labels.description:
Labels specify the labels to add to the metric.

only one of the following should be specified depending on the type of metric

RuleSample.description: Sample is the configuration for a sample rule.

good_query_template.description:
A PromQL query that measures the number of "good" events for this SLI.
Either this or the bad_query_template must be set.

bad_query_template.description:
A PromQL query that measures the number of "bad" events for this SLI.
Either this or the good_query_template must be set.

total_query_template.description:
A PromQL query that measures the total number of events for this SLI.
This is required for all advanced SLIs.

SLICustomIndicatorConfig.title:
CustomIndicatorConfig is for SLIs that are not associated with Chronosphere
Lens supported SLO types. They are provided with several variables that can
be used in the template to generate the query:
- Window (required)
- GroupBy (required)
- LensService (optional)

SLIEndpointAvailabilityConfig.description: Configuration for an endpoint availability SLI.

endpoints_monitored.description:
the API endpoints to monitor in the SLO. If this is left empty then all
endpoints will be monitored.

error_codes.description:
A list of result codes that indicate an unsuccessful event. Either this
or success_codes must be set.

additional_promql_filters.description:
These are added to _every_ query and are intended to be used for things
like `cluster!~"dev"`

SLIEndpointLatencyConfig.description: Configuration for an endpoint latency SLI.

endpoints_monitored.description:
the API endpoints to monitor in the SLO. If this is left empty then all
endpoints will be monitored.

latency_bucket.description: The name of the histogram metric that measures latency.

additional_promql_filters.description:
These are added to _every_ query and are intended to be used for things
like `cluster!~"dev"`

reporting_windows.description:
The reporting windows for this SLO. The SLO is considered breached if the
error budget is depleted in any of these windows.

low_volume.description:
Configured whether this SLO is for a low volume event (< 1/s). This will
adjust the SLI queries to account for the low volume nature of the event.

min_time.description: Start time of the search interval.

max_time.description: End time of the search interval.

time.description: Time around which the search will performed.

start_relative_offset_secs.description: The duration, in seconds, from now to the beginning of the search interval.

end_relative_offset_secs.description: The duration, in seconds, from now to the end of the search interval.

diff.description: TODO: do we want to keep diff in the public API?

severity_label_name.description:
Customer-specific name of alert rule label used to determine severity.
If omitted, the Chronosphere default of "severity" is used.

assign_monitor_slugs.description: TODO: before configv1 - is this still required? does chronoctl set it?

monitor_signal_per_series.description: If true, each monitor will not group alert notifications.

infer_monitor_signals.description: Controls whether we try to infer monitor signals from the alertmanager route tree.

group_across_severities.description:
If true, we set the the group_across_severities flag on notification policies to
true, so that warn and critical notifications are grouped together.

TODO:  i don't think we export this on notification policies in the public API,
       we may need to figure out a better solution here (do we need to expose
       in both, or do we need to update the comment to stop referring to the
       option on the policy?)

exists_op_supported.description:
If true, alert rule expressions that are not in the form of "expr op number" (e.g. "sum(stuff) > 5")
will be executed as-is.
Without this set, expressions will be converted to binary expressions (e.g. "x > y" as "(x - y) > 0").

TODO: before configv1 - is this still required? does chronoctl set it?

SyncPrometheusContainerType.title: TODO: confirm naming with InfoModel team

default_sampling_rate.description: Defines the service-wide sampling probability (in the range [0, 1]) when specific operations are not matched.

default_lower_bound_traces_per_second.description: Defines a minimum number of traces to send for ANY operation in the service, regardless of matching per operation strategy.

default_upper_bound_traces_per_second.description: Defines a maximum number of traces to send for ANY operation in the service, regardless of matching per operation strategy.

per_operation_strategies.description: Defines explicit operations-specific strategies that take precedence over the default sampling rate.

sampling_rate.description: Value in the range [0, 1] that defines the probability of sampling any trace.

max_traces_per_second.description: Maximum number of traces to sample per second.

value.description: The value the filter compares to the target trace or span field.

min.description: Minimum number of spans that must match a SpanFilter (inclusive).

max.description: Maximum number of spans that must match a SpanFilter (inclusive).

min_secs.description: Minimum duration, in seconds, required for a span or trace to match.

max_secs.description: Maximum duration, in seconds, required for a span or trace to match.

value.description: The filter value used in comparison against match candidates.

tags.description: Matches the tags of the candidate.

value.description: The value the filter compares to the target trace or span field.

in_values.description: Values the filter tests against when using IN or NOT_IN match type.

key.description: The key (or name) of the span tag that is inspected by this filter.

tag_name.description: Tag name that uniquely identifies a tag.

description.description: Human readable description of the tag.

code.description: An optional private error code whose values are undefined.

message.description: An error message describing what went wrong.

configunstableControlRule.description: ControlRule is the configuration for an ordered set of rules.

name.description: Name is the name of the control rule.

rules.description: Rules are the rules operating on the filtered logs.

dry_run.description: If true, the LinkTemplate will not be created, and no response LinkTemplate will be returned. The response will return an error if the given LinkTemplate is invalid.
If true, the LogControlConfig will not be created, and no response LogControlConfig will be returned. The response will return an error if the given LogControlConfig is invalid.
If true, the SLO will not be created, and no response SLO will be returned. The response will return an error if the given SLO is invalid.
If true, the Service will not be created, and no response Service will be returned. The response will return an error if the given Service is invalid.

If true, the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy will not be created, and no response TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy will be returned. The response will return an error if the given TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy is invalid.
If true, the TraceTailSamplingRules will not be created, and no response TraceTailSamplingRules will be returned. The response will return an error if the given TraceTailSamplingRules is invalid.
If true, the TraceTopTagConfig will not be created, and no response TraceTopTagConfig will be returned. The response will return an error if the given TraceTopTagConfig is invalid.

slug.description: Unique identifier of the Dashboard. If slug is not provided, one will be generated based of the name field. Cannot be modified after the Dashboard is created.

name.description: Required name of the Dashboard. May be modified after the Dashboard is created.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the Dashboard was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the Dashboard was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

collection_slug.description: Required slug of the collection the dashboard belongs to.

dashboard_json.description: Required raw JSON of the dashboard.

enabled.description: Whether to override the default sample rate

sample_rate.description: A fraction of traces to keep, which should be a number between 0 and 1, inclusive

configunstableFilter.description: Filter is the filter configuration for a control rule.

labels.description: Labels are the key value pairs to specify which logs to control.

configunstableLabel.description: Label is a key, value pair used for filtering.

name.description: Unique name of the LinkTemplate. Used as the link text.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the LinkTemplate was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the LinkTemplate was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

ui_component.description: Link template is scoped to the specified string representing a UI component here.

configunstableLogControlConfig.description:
LogControlConfig is a singleton configuration object that specifies the
configuration for log control.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the LogControlConfig was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the LogControlConfig was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

control_rules.description: Control Rules are the ordered list of control rules.

slug.description: Unique identifier of the NoopEntity. If slug is not provided, one will be generated based of the name field. Cannot be modified after the NoopEntity is created.

name.description: Required name of the NoopEntity. May be modified after the NoopEntity is created.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the NoopEntity was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the NoopEntity was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

slug.description: Unique identifier of the ObjectDiscoveryRule. If slug is not provided, one will be generated based of the name field. Cannot be modified after the ObjectDiscoveryRule is created.

name.description: Required name of the ObjectDiscoveryRule. May be modified after the ObjectDiscoveryRule is created.
Prometheus label name for the matcher

value.description: Prometheus label value for the matcher

configunstableRule.description: Rule is the configuration for a rule.

configunstableSLI.description:
SLI is a service level indicator. The contents of this proto are intended to
be used to generate queries necessary to measure SLOs.

lens_template_indicator.description:
Indicates which Chronosphere service discovery template is used to build
the SLI queries

endpoint_label.description:
This overrides the equivalent ComponentDiscovery.MetricMetadata field as it
is common to change

custom_dimension_labels.description:
Custom dimensions are used to configure additional labels to export from
the underlying queries. This feature provides a logical budget to group
unique combination of dimensions. For example, if you want to track a
budget per endpoint, add the endpoint label as a dimension. These dimensions
are provided on the top-level SLI so that queryful SLOs will receive them
in `.GroupBy`.

slug.description: Unique identifier of the SLO. If slug is not provided, one will be generated based of the name field. Cannot be modified after the SLO is created.

name.description: Required name of the SLO. May be modified after the SLO is created.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the SLO was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the SLO was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

notification_policy_slug.description:
Optional notification policy to explicitly apply to the generated monitors.
If this is not set then the team this SLO will belong to must have a
default notification policy

annotations.description:
Annotations are visible in notifications generated by this SLO
They can be be templated with labels from notifications.

labels.description:
Labels are visible in notifications generated by this SLO,
and can be used to route alerts with notification overrides.

name.description: Required name of the SavedTraceSearch. May be modified after the SavedTraceSearch is created.

slug.description: Unique identifier of the SavedTraceSearch. If slug is not provided, one will be generated based of the name field. Cannot be modified after the SavedTraceSearch is created.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the SavedTraceSearch was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the SavedTraceSearch was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

slug.description: Unique identifier of the Service. If slug is not provided, one will be generated based of the name field. Cannot be modified after the Service is created.

name.description: Required name of the Service. May be modified after the Service is created.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the Service was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the Service was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

derived_name.description: Required telemetry name of the service.

team_slug.description: Required slug of the team the service collection belongs to.

description.description: Optional description of the service collection.

notification_policy_slug.description:
Slug of the notification policy used by default for monitors in this service collection.
This is optional if the collection does not contain monitors or all of its monitors explicitly reference a policy.
This does not override the policy used when a monitor explicitly references a policy.

slug.description: Unique identifier of the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy. If slug is not provided, one will be generated based of the name field. Cannot be modified after the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy is created.

name.description: Required name of the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy. May be modified after the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy is created.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

service_name.description: The name of the service this sampling strategy applies to. This must match the slug and name fields.

configunstableTraceTailSamplingRule.description: Contains configuration for one tail sampling rule.

sample_rate.description: A fraction of traces to keep, which should be a number between 0 and 1, inclusive

name.description: A human-readable name of the rule, which summarizes what it's for

system_name.description: Value used as the metric label value for metrics emitted relating to this rule.

created_at.description: When the rule was created (novel system_name)

updated_at.description: When the rule was updated (existing system_name)

configunstableTraceTailSamplingRules.description: Root object containing all tail sampling rules (for a tenant).

rules.description:
Optional. A list of rules, evaluated in order until a match is found,
and the sample rate applied, or else the default sample rate is applied.

configunstableTraceTopTagConfig.description:
TraceTopTagConfig is a singleton configuration object that specifies the
configuration for top tracing tags.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the TraceTopTagConfig was created. Cannot be set by clients.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the TraceTopTagConfig was last updated. Cannot be set by clients.

top_tags.description: The list of "top" tags. Must be unique by tag_name.

create_if_missing.description: If true, the LogControlConfig will be created if it does not already exist. If false, an error will be returned if the LogControlConfig does not already exist.

dry_run.description: If true, the LogControlConfig will not be created nor updated, and no response LogControlConfig will be returned. The response will return an error if the given LogControlConfig is invalid.

create_if_missing.description: If true, the TraceTailSamplingRules will be created if it does not already exist. If false, an error will be returned if the TraceTailSamplingRules does not already exist.

dry_run.description: If true, the TraceTailSamplingRules will not be created nor updated, and no response TraceTailSamplingRules will be returned. The response will return an error if the given TraceTailSamplingRules is invalid.

create_if_missing.description: If true, the TraceTopTagConfig will be created if it does not already exist. If false, an error will be returned if the TraceTopTagConfig does not already exist.

dry_run.description: If true, the TraceTopTagConfig will not be created nor updated, and no response TraceTopTagConfig will be returned. The response will return an error if the given TraceTopTagConfig is invalid.

max_size.description:
Page size preference (i.e. how many items are returned in the next
page). If zero, the server will use a default. Regardless of what size
is given, clients must never assume how many items will be returned.

token.description:
Opaque page token identifying which page to request. An empty token
identifies the first page.

next_token.description:
Opaque page token which identifies the next page of items which the
client should request. An empty next_token indicates that there are no
more items to return.

span.description:
Each SpanFilter object represents all conditions that need to be true on
the same span for the span to be considered matching the SpanFilter. If
`span_count` is used, the number of spans within the trace that match the
SpanFilter needs to be within [min, max]. Multiple SpanFilters can be used,
and each can be satisfied by any number of spans within the trace.

info.description: WARNING: This API is unstable and is meant for experimentation only. Do not use this API in production. The endpoints and schemas referenced in this documentation will be changed or removed without notice and without any backwards compatibility guarantee. Note that even though this API is unstable, it is still connected to production data, so use with caution.
info.title: Config Unstable API

parameters.description:
Page size preference (i.e. how many items are returned in the next
page). If zero, the server will use a default. Regardless of what size
is given, clients must never assume how many items will be returned.
parameters.name: page.max_size

parameters.description:
Opaque page token identifying which page to request. An empty token
identifies the first page.
parameters.name: page.token

parameters.description: Filters results by slug, where any Dashboard with a matching slug in the given list (and matches all other filters) is returned.
parameters.name: slugs

parameters.description: Filters results by collection_slug, where any Dashboard with a matching collection_slug in the given list (and matches all other filters) is returned.
parameters.name: collection_slugs

parameters.description: Filters results by name, where any Dashboard with a matching name in the given list (and matches all other filters) is returned.
parameters.name: names

parameters.description:
Optional flag to populate the dashboard_json of the returned dashboards.
By default, dashboard_json will be left empty.
parameters.name: include_dashboard_json

200.description: A successful response containing the created Dashboard.

400.description: Cannot create the Dashboard because the request is invalid.

409.description: Cannot create the Dashboard because there is a conflict with an existing Dashboard.

400.description: Cannot delete the Dashboard because it is in use.

404.description: Cannot delete the Dashboard because the slug does not exist.
Cannot read the Dashboard because the slug does not exist.

200.description: A successful response containing the updated Dashboard.

400.description: Cannot update the Dashboard because the request is invalid.

404.description: Cannot update the Dashboard because the slug does not exist.

409.description: Cannot update the Dashboard because there is a conflict with an existing Dashboard.

parameters.description:
Page size preference (i.e. how many items are returned in the next
page). If zero, the server will use a default. Regardless of what size
is given, clients must never assume how many items will be returned.
parameters.name: page.max_size

parameters.description:
Opaque page token identifying which page to request. An empty token
identifies the first page.
parameters.name: page.token

parameters.description: Filters results by slug, where any TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy with a matching slug in the given list (and matches all other filters) is returned.
parameters.name: slugs

parameters.description: Filters results by name, where any TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy with a matching name in the given list (and matches all other filters) is returned.
parameters.name: names

parameters.description: Filters results by service_name, where any TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy with a matching service_name in the given list (and matches all other filters) is returned.
parameters.name: service_names

200.description: A successful response containing the created TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy.

400.description: Cannot create the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy because the request is invalid.

409.description: Cannot create the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy because there is a conflict with an existing TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy.

400.description: Cannot delete the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy because it is in use.

404.description: Cannot delete the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy because the slug does not exist.
Cannot read the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy because the slug does not exist.

200.description: A successful response containing the updated TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy.

400.description: Cannot update the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy because the request is invalid.

404.description: Cannot update the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy because the slug does not exist.

409.description: Cannot update the TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy because there is a conflict with an existing TraceJaegerRemoteSamplingStrategy.

400.description: Cannot delete the TraceTailSamplingRules because it is in use.

404.description: Cannot delete the TraceTailSamplingRules because the slug does not exist.
Cannot read the TraceTailSamplingRules because TraceTailSamplingRules has not been created.

200.description: A successful response containing the created TraceTailSamplingRules.

400.description: Cannot create the TraceTailSamplingRules because the request is invalid.

409.description: Cannot create the TraceTailSamplingRules because there is a conflict with an existing TraceTailSamplingRules.

200.description: A successful response containing the updated TraceTailSamplingRules.

400.description: Cannot update the TraceTailSamplingRules because the request is invalid.

404.description: Cannot update the TraceTailSamplingRules because TraceTailSamplingRules has not been created.

400.description: Cannot delete the TraceTopTagConfig because it is in use.

404.description: Cannot delete the TraceTopTagConfig because the slug does not exist.
Cannot read the TraceTopTagConfig because TraceTopTagConfig has not been created.

200.description: A successful response containing the created TraceTopTagConfig.

400.description: Cannot create the TraceTopTagConfig because the request is invalid.

409.description: Cannot create the TraceTopTagConfig because there is a conflict with an existing TraceTopTagConfig.

200.description: A successful response containing the updated TraceTopTagConfig.

400.description: Cannot update the TraceTopTagConfig because the request is invalid.

404.description: Cannot update the TraceTopTagConfig because TraceTopTagConfig has not been created.
